description: This type of Song dynasty blackware—iron-rich, chocolate-brown stoneware with lustrous dark glazes—is popularly referred to as temmoku, the Japanese name of a mountain in south China and the site of a Buddhist monastery where Japanese monks treasured bowls like this example for tea-drinking rituals. The conical shape fit perfectly in cupped hands, and the color visually intensified the milky froth of white tea.
title: Tea Bowl
